title: So are the corrupted Star Guardians corrupted from the Dark Star??
body:
Alot of people I know are saying the Zoe, Xayah and Rakan SG look alot like a Dark Star due to having main give aways to what a Dark Star's appearance is even if they are a corrupted being (Like Rhaast/Kayn or Jhin) They contain features of the Dark Star

Main Dark Stars (Stuff that didnt corrupt a entity Kha, Cho, Thresh, etc): Lots of purple and dark colors, black hole somewhere on body or weapon, and some can have a 4 pointed star like Dark Cosmic Jhin's face when he has his forth shot and has his mask off and Kha'Zix

Rhaast: Dark colors with the black armor and purple somewhere on the body, Black hole, faceless, and containing stuff from the universe with the golden Ora

Jhin: Dark pants and arms, Purple all around body, Black hole gun and shoulder piece, faceless head, 4 pointed star

Now looking at the SG Rakan, Zoe and Xayah

Zoe, Xayah, Rakan: Dark purples and black, 4 pointed star on her eye and her familiar, and ofcourse has Star Guardian features

Unless its a coincidence maybe these Star Guardians are corrupted by the Dark Star in some sense. You can even see Xayah fix her corruption when she touches her gem so maybe the SG magic repels the corruption slightly?

replies.body:
Are Dark Star/Cosmic and Star Guardian in the same universe? Nope.

Is it possible? Probably, but not likely.

I believe the only way the Dark Star could have gotten to that universe is if a gate were opened, like with what happened with Rhaast(who is a Dark Star entity) in the Odyssey universe.

When someone is corrupted by the Dark Star, I believe 2 things can happen. They can become a Dark Star entity, an all consuming entity of nothingness, a failed corruptant. Or, they could become a Dark Cosmic, a pure corruptant. They could also just cease to exist entirely.

The corruption of the Star Guardians is likely tied to their gems, not the Dark Star. If they lose their gems, or they get damaged, they become corrupted. That's why when Rakan gives Xayah his gem, he goes completely dark while she becomes whole again and turns green(green is the color of Rakan's gem).

> [{quoted}](name=4 Step Cadence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UBVEalQ3,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-27T03:27:55.743+0000)
>
> Are Dark Star/Cosmic and Star Guardian in the same universe? Nope.
> 
> Is it possible? Probably, but not likely.
> 
> I believe the only way the Dark Star could have gotten to that universe is if a gate were opened, like with what happened with Rhaast(who is a Dark Star entity) in the Odyssey universe.
> 
> When someone is corrupted by the Dark Star, I believe 2 things can happen. They can become a Dark Star entity, an all consuming entity of nothingness, a failed corruptant. Or, they could become a Dark Cosmic, a pure corruptant. They could also just cease to exist entirely.
> 
> The corruption of the Star Guardians is likely tied to their gems, not the Dark Star. If they lose their gems, or they get damaged, they become corrupted. That's why when Rakan gives Xayah his gem, he goes completely dark while she becomes whole again and turns green(green is the color of Rakan's gem).

As of now, I think Rhaast confirmed the Dark Star still haven't reached the Star Guardian universe, but he would surely love to...

**Upon First Encounter With An Enemy Star Guardian Champion**
Odyssey Rhaast: _"Well now, I'm not familiar with your universe. But oh, how I could be."_

I think that the Dark Star works another way:

If what it "eats"is a galaxy, or a system, it "births" a corruptant, that seems to be the case with most of them. If it manages to eat a celestial, living entities conformed by stars, then what comes out is a Dark Cosmic....or nothing, and it gets deleted forever, we are talking about a Black Hole after all.

Neeko's gem seems to be damaged too in the teaser, and Xayah/Rakan seem to keep their gems, or at least a copy, if their recall is right, so it might be something more related to Zoe and her madness than to the gems, I'm not sure about this though, so I will await some lore that confirms or denies it. I can only hope they don't tie Dark Star and Star Guardians beyond what they already are, with the First Star probably being a Celestial

The lore could be something like this, based on what is already confirmed and the assumptions we can make based on what we've seen so far.

* Zoe is an older Star Guardian in terms of when her team was formed.


* Zoe lost her team, and became so grief stricken/insane that she took Ahri's team away from her just so that she would have a team again.


* In order to get them, though, she had to corrupt them too, which would likely involve damaging them and/or their gems. This is why the gems Ahri is holding in the teaser are small and broken.


* Ahri likely made new gems or repaired the old ones(if that's even possible) in order to save her old team.


* The yellow gem worked on Neeko, as she is no longer corrupted. However, the blue gem failed to save Xayah(perhaps Zoe tried to stop Ahri and damaged it in the process), while Rakan's still works, but he doesn't appear to be using it(in the splash art, he is hold it rather than wearing it like the other Star Guardians).


* Knowing that the gem is the only way to save Xayah, he sacrifices himself to save her, which is why Xayah turns green when she takes the gem, while Rakan becomes fully corrupted. The gem was the only thing keeping him "alive", pretty much.

Its almost certainly tied to the gems somehow, but we'll have to wait and see how exactly this goes.

Its definitely not Dark Star corruption, though. That looks and does entirely different things. Plus, darkness is the overall theme for corruption in pretty much everything, so them being black/purple doesn't automatically make them Dark Star corruptants.

> [{quoted}](name=4 Step Cadence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UBVEalQ3,comment-id=000000020000,timestamp=2019-08-27T08:00:12.744+0000)
>
> The lore could be something like this, based on what is already confirmed and the assumptions we can make based on what we've seen so far.
> 
> * Zoe is an older Star Guardian in terms of when her team was formed.
> 
> 
> * Zoe lost her team, and became so grief stricken/insane that she took Ahri's team away from her just so that she would have a team again.
> 
> 
> * In order to get them, though, she had to corrupt them too, which would likely involve damaging them and/or their gems. This is why the gems Ahri is holding in the teaser are small and broken.
> 
> 
> * Ahri likely made new gems or repaired the old ones(if that's even possible) in order to save her old team.
> 
> 
> * The yellow gem worked on Neeko, as she is no longer corrupted. However, the blue gem failed to save Xayah(perhaps Zoe tried to stop Ahri and damaged it in the process), while Rakan's still works, but he doesn't appear to be using it(in the splash art, he is hold it rather than wearing it like the other Star Guardians).
> 
> 
> * Knowing that the gem is the only way to save Xayah, he sacrifices himself to save her, which is why Xayah turns green when she takes the gem, while Rakan becomes fully corrupted. The gem was the only thing keeping him "alive", pretty much.
> 
> Its almost certainly tied to the gems somehow, but we'll have to wait and see how exactly this goes.
> 
> Its definitely not Dark Star corruption, though. That looks and does entirely different things. Plus, darkness is the overall theme for corruption in pretty much everything, so them being black/purple doesn't automatically make them Dark Star corruptants.

I'm quite curious about what explanation they will give to this situation, Ahri does have the old, broken gems, but these skins also have theirs, the only explanation would be that someone crafted new ones, but I'm not sure Ahri nor Zoe has that power, because its starlight, they should only come from Celestials right?

I wouldn't be surprised to know Zoe tainted these new gems in some way, maybe using something similar to the Madness Wavelenght in Soul Eater, maybe outright corrupting the gems, but the second theory is a bit shabby as we see Rakan sending his gem off to Xayah and falling into darkness himself..

Have the splashes been revealed already? Could you post a link to them? I'm also curious to see them. 

Don't think that sending the gem off kills Rakan, but makes him get completelly corrupted for a while, it seems that using their powers is what corrupt them more and more each time, although it might just be a gameplay mechanic (Why doesn't Zoe get a similar Dark Aura?....)

Yes, Dark Star is too big to take time to corrupt a Star Guardian, if only it would devour the whole galaxy to craft another Corruptant, but it does worries me that they seem to have the same star mark than Dark Celestial Jhin, it looks cool, but I feel that they might be stepping into dangerous terrain

All the Dark Stars have that mark if I'm not mistaken. Or, at least, if not all of them, Jhin isn't the only one with it.

But even then, combining the Dark Star/Cosmic universe with Star Guardian creates a whole new problem: Xayah, Rakan, and Lulu all have Cosmic skins. You can't have 2 skins for the same champion that exist in the same universe unless they make sense, like Popstar Ahri being her before she joined/started K/DA.

And yeah... The Dark Star would consume that universe in its entirety and leave nothing behind except a corruptant born from the destruction. Rhaast would probably do the same to the Odyssey universe if he could.

Also, don't you think Riot would have used Jhin's legendary to tease such an event? He has no special interactions with the Star Guardians, if I'm not mistaken. In fact, he seems more interested in invading the Odyssey universe than anything.

As for the splash arts, they are in [this](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/uyFMA9I3-some-feedback-on-star-guardian-2019?comment=000e) post. Rakan's gem may or may not be his "mirror" for this skin.

> 
> But even then, combining the Dark Star/Cosmic universe with Star Guardian creates a whole new problem: Xayah, Rakan, and Lulu all have Cosmic skins. You can't have 2 skins for the same champion that exist in the same universe unless they make sense, like Popstar Ahri being her before she joined/started K/DA.

Do they? Haven't really checked on them since they came out, so I wouldn't know.

There are a lot of possible explanation for that skin overlapping, like that those fragments are attuned with the light of said celestials and they modify the user to more or less resemble them upon first use, or that they are the reencarnation of those Celestials and that's what makes them worthy of being Star Guardians... But I would hate that they mixed Eldrich Horrors with Magic Girls.

Yeah, you're right, they probably would have used Jhin to tease such conection in any way, even more knowing that this Corrupted Star Guardian turn was probably planned by RIOT since the second batch of skins.

Thanks, i was eager to see the splashes, even more after reading that Xayah/Rakan's was specially beautifull, and it is, but I think I will keep DC Jhin as wallpaper, they look cool, but not more than him

Yeah. I really like X&R's splash art. Xayah's hands though... Yikes. You probably can't see them in that one, but I believe the ring finger on her right hand is way too thin, and her left hand only has 3 fingers if I'm not mistaken.

> [{quoted}](name=4 Step Cadence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UBVEalQ3,comment-id=0000000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-27T12:20:16.214+0000)
>
> her left hand only has 3 fingers if I'm not mistaken.

oh god, i can't unsee it now!!

> [{quoted}](name=4 Step Cadence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UBVEalQ3,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-27T03:27:55.743+0000)
>
> Are Dark Star/Cosmic and Star Guardian in the same universe? Nope.
> 

Yeah I was thinking that Rhaast opened the gate which is why they came to the Cosmic universe with Dark Cosmic Jhin then they jumped to the Star Guardian universe but it might make sense with the gems. Also didnt know they were apart of the same universe as cosmic tbh

> [{quoted}](name=Zombie Slayer,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UBVEalQ3,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2019-08-27T05:01:31.172+0000)
>
> Yeah I was thinking that Rhaast opened the gate which is why they came to the Cosmic universe with Dark Cosmic Jhin then they jumped to the Star Guardian universe but it might make sense with the gems. Also didnt know they were apart of the same universe as cosmic tbh

Cosmic beings seem to exist, confirmed at least in Odyssey (Ora) and Runeterra dimensions (Aurelion Sol and Siblings), about Corruptants, they seem to not be as common as Cosmics, that are creators and so, them being present in every dimension is quite logical. The Dark Star seems to be a singularity acting like a virus, spreading from one dimension to another, devouring not only the dimension where it spawned, but also everything else it can reach, but seems to have a hard time opening portals, having to rely on other opening them
This is some steven universe shit and I like it.

You all make me feel so fucking old and uninformed because I have no idea what any of this crap is. Fuck, I barely know how most modern technology works. I'm 18 for fuck's sake.

I'm not a weeb nor do I really watch cartoons all that much. Enlighten me, ones who partake in this sort of thing, because I am clueless.

It's a Cartoon Network show that finished so not surprising tbh. 

Basically what Terozu said. 'Gems' are aliens who have a gem embedded in a part of their body which projects their hardlight body. They've got magic and are a space fairing race. If they are hurt too much they retreat into their gem. If their gem is cracked then they suffer permenant physical+psychological damage, and it can be corrupted which causes them to turn into monstrous tormented versions of themselves.

Major fucking spoilers and i dont know how to spoiler tag im sorry.

Gems are hard light constructs projected from living gem stones.

If they run out of light they go dormant and they can be corrupted.

Taking a gems gem is basically killing them cept for steven whos half human and splits into a hardlight form and a flesh form.

Dark Star isn't in the same universe as Star Guardian. I guess they could change their minds, but as we know it currently, they aren't in the same skin universe. Dark Star is the enemy of the Cosmic/Odyssey skin lines.

Supposedly they're not even in the same universe which is a real shame. You would think the Dark Star and the First Star would be natural enemies. Maybe some day Riot will have enough sense to merge the two.

The enemy to the Dark Star is the Cosmics. The Dark Star exists to destroy what the Cosmics make in order to keep the universe balanced. The Dark Star/Cosmic universe is about literal gods, while Star Guardian is a Sailor Moon rip-off.

The 2 universes have literally nothing to do with each other and likely never will.
Are you telling me Sailor Moon rip-offs shouldn't have the chance to face off against intergalactic deities?

The Star Guardians already have enemies, as was seen in the Invasion game mode. They fighting general alien threats if I'm not mistaken. Literally no point in fusing the 2 skin lines.

Plus, they're 2 completely different genres of skins. Dark Star/Cosmic is a serious, eldritch horror skin line about gods and the balance of the universe through constant creation/destruction. Star Guardian is about high school students fighting alien threats anime-style. They would not mix well at all.

They fight the void, actually.

And due to Dark Stars nature, they exist in all skin lines.  Well probably just never see them in most.

> [{quoted}](name=BlackKnightJack,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=UBVEalQ3,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2019-08-27T03:43:20.698+0000)
>
> Are you telling me Sailor Moon rip-offs shouldn't have the chance to face off against intergalactic deities?

virgin star guardians vs chad dark stars
I dunno. I think the Star Guardians can win with enough authorial bias.
I do find it suspicious that Sg Ds and Cats vs Dogs share a similar star theme both in design and their effects.
